@Kaa_telemetry @SEGandrewK @theriverstrust @N_Rivers_Trust Check out this horrific weir on a Norfolk Chalkstream preventing all fish/eel migration from 5 miles of river streams & ponds @PondRiverStream @EnvAgencyAnglia https://t.co/PIqeqzqmcF

Thanks everyone for making #JNCC_EO4water such a success! @BrockmannCon @PlymouthMarine @EMODnet @CefasGovUK @EnvAgency @StirUni @ScottishEPA @UniRdg_Met @geoaquawatch @DefraGovUK & of course @CopernicusEU If you missed it, the videos, slides & other resources are now available! https://t.co/B2hZ2aTsno

@CamCurat @AquiferChalk @defra @EnvAgency If the EA are doing such a fabulous job your MP might want to ask why then in Nov 2019 was the Cam the only river in England recorded as having "Exceptionally low" flows?

Jun 2020, 41% long term average flows (LTA).

Jul 2020, 42% "LTA.

Aug 2020, 47% LTA.

*Data EA https://t.co/wlYDs4qOQ6

Dog poo contains bacteria which can be harmful to people & wildlife. 

💙Make sure when you are out with your dog this half term you clean up after them!

🌊Keep our water healthy for everyone, even if you're not  near a beach! 

#BagItBinIt #BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/I2vGET8kPH

tweets.text:
Er, sorry to bring you more bad news, but remember how we're running out of water because nobody's had the cojones to create policies securing supplies? And that some parts of England are predicted to go dry in around 5 years without action? Well... 1/7
https://t.co/OPcRvlcJoQ

"We constantly innovate to do more with less. But ultimately we will get the environment we pay for. A core part of that is funding the @EnvAgency properly." 

My letter to @thetimes quoted in their article about cuts to UK regulators today. https://t.co/9qGJ8JzWBf

Full text 👇 https://t.co/BNpdhz7Z8a

Following public feedback proposals for an essential 1.1km flood wall in West Kirby have been redesigned to take on board local suggestions. Detailed plans for the new flood wall, will be officially lodged this week. https://t.co/t7H8LZLyvu @EnvAgency https://t.co/UCA4piY50Z

Container ships have been found washed up on the coast in North Devon. If you are able to support in the clean up, please get in touch with your local SAS rep, document what you find and tag us in pictures the of your beach clean.

We don’t want these items heading out to sea!😫 https://t.co/pCfBIJNAm4

Read now: https://t.co/qeL97cIkwR

#pressrelease #dataquality https://t.co/JKXNAnjy3a
WATCH Becca and Alice invertebrate sampling on the #Wandle #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek https://t.co/I53WP67pbN

Our team have been carrying out electric fishing surveys recently with positive results!

By felling trees into the channels creating log jams, it improves the river habitat remarkably! Lot's of brown trout here! 🐟🌳🐟 @SouthWestPeak @EnvAgency @HeritageFundNW @NickMott7 https://t.co/cnpfQRis0X

tweets.text: Hmmmmm some potentially heavy rainfall in Wales and through our patch later this week. Ground conditions remain wet and any rain will see river levels rise. Our folk are ready 24/7 monitoring and ready to respond. Stay up to date and vigilant . #BetterPrepared #FloodAware https://t.co/TyCPBMmM8i
Great start to the morning @RTPIPlanners Webinar, thank you Matt Ellis @EnvAgency now time for Amy Kennedy @DeloitteUK https://t.co/HrEsqOMLZ6

tweets.text:
This October #HalfTerm join all those helping to keep our beaches and bathing waters safe for all to enjoy 

#BagItBinIt
#BinIt4Beaches #RespectProtectEnjoy https://t.co/PbSyjodlrk

Brilliant @Unchecked_UK report shows effects of severe funding cuts at @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency on enforcement. They need major capital & revenue investment at #SpendingReview to fulfil current functions, let alone deliver the #EnvironmentBill & #ELM.

https://t.co/CCvpt8Gk7O
@JamieHutt0n @jeanrobinson946 @AquaUoS @EnvAgencyNW @WildHaweswater @NECumbria @unitedutilities @ThrimbyFarms Jamie, a terrible admission! Let me know when you're in the area, I'll try to join you.
@Thamesbuoy @oliverpitt @EnvAgency @HugoSAS Correct.

Vicky was in the #Wandle last week helping our wonderfully mysterious eels to migrate through London.
#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek #WorldFishMigrationDay  #WandleHeritageTrust https://t.co/1g0gGhkHx0

Look who was found in the #Thames recently! Historically a common sight, the migratory Twaite shad is now rare and it was great to see it near Blackfriars in Central London! #WorldFishMigrationDay #LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek #TidewayLondon https://t.co/MjBH1APVkg

WATCH: Here’s Dave in the rewilded #Surbiton Stream in south-west London. 

Working to restore rivers for wildlife and for the future! 
#LRW2020 #LondonRiversWeek @RBKingston https://t.co/ZGU8kSbvOz

The videos and presentations from our workshop Using #EarthObservation for water quality monitoring are now available to download from our website https://t.co/R5WhZK2Mrd Thanks again to everyone for making it such a great event! #JNCC_EO4water https://t.co/K6i6ONNGyh

Yesterday, @DaveThroupEA tweeted a video of salmon at a weir. 

Today, with only my small lens I went to hopefully capture my first glimpse of the salmon run in the wild. 

Oh my god - just incredible. I somehow managed these photos! 

@BBCCountryfile @bbcweather @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/YWEv3V9no4

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

tweets.text: @leeinthelakes @jeanrobinson946 @AquaUoS @EnvAgencyNW @WildHaweswater @NECumbria @unitedutilities @ThrimbyFarms Just been looking it up on the maps after watching Murray at Swindale on This Farming Life - it’s a slice of Cumbria I’ve yet to walk through! Looks great.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: This Farming Life
entity.description: The working day begins as the sun rises above the horizon and it ends long after the sun has set. Across Scotland and Northern Ireland, the struggles and triumphs of farmers and their families are documented to give a unique perspective into the lives of those providing the nation with milk, meat and more. Against a backdrop of some of Britain's most remote and beautiful locations, these farmers go about their day with unprecedented dedication as they tend to their animals, harvest their crops, and care for their own families, as they endeavour to keep everything on the farm running smoothly during often testing times.

tweets.text: This 👇. I don’t normally comment on politics, but regulation and enforcement is probably the only thing that @EnvAgency can do that partners can’t. We must resource it properly if we want the environment to improve. https://t.co/Y8MF7sCkAD

@Collierlaunches @HCRCMary @SurreyFRS @ResiAssociation @MoleseySteve @KingstonRUG @EnvAgencySE @MariaHerlihyEA Odd that the combined legislative forces of the EA, Surrey F&RS and local environmental health cannot shut down these businesses for non-compliance of safety regs in some form.
@jeanrobinson946 @JamieHutt0n @AquaUoS @EnvAgencyNW @WildHaweswater @NECumbria @unitedutilities @ThrimbyFarms It is indeed, just snuck into shot.

We all know water likes to move💧🕺

So it’s important we give it space to 👈 stretch out 👉 where we can. 

This week our reconnected floodplain in Swindale is doing its job well, holding water in the landscape.

Read more at https://t.co/UgynwzMVjY

📸 L Schofield (this week) https://t.co/sspv2YffTk

A message for farmers⚠️

We are having a lot of rain, so please check lagoons and tanks to make sure you have a freeboard of 750mm for lagoons and 300mm for tanks.

Guidance here: https://t.co/NqhOabhur4 #rain #Farmers https://t.co/fq10dsosJw

How it started // How it's going #SphagnumMonday https://t.co/9iRWFHbcSQ

Anyone who knows @WoodlandTrust #SmihtillsEstate knows it’s wet! We’re carrying out #NaturalFloodManagement works to hold back the flows of water to help water subside better down stream @livuni @EnvAgencyNW @merseyforest https://t.co/LwQgBNOTaW

With the help of our volunteers we've finished treating Japanese knotweed within the catchment for this year.  It's good to see lots of native wildflowers recolonising areas of the river bank where the knotweed has been eradicated #inns #japaneseknotweed @YISF__INNS @EnvAgency 🍃 https://t.co/d5SC7dYVnI

The UK's wild oyster population has declined over 95% due to over-harvesting, habitat loss & pollution.

We're delighted to be working with the @Wild_Oysters project and @EnvAgencyYNE to restore the 20,000 square kilometres of oyster reefs lost in the North East of England 🦪 https://t.co/mvspWHXO8k

tweets.text: @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency Do we need both NE & EA?  Whichever we need has to be properly accountable and hasn’t been really since the National Rivers Agency was morphed into EA

@TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency That's true. You'll know how under-resouced AONB teams feel when all 34 of them combined get Defra funding equivalent to less than half that of the (no doubt under-funded)  South Downs Nat Park Authority alone. Same as the budget of 1 medium sized Secondary school.

urls.title: Sewage signals early warning of coronavirus outbreaks
urls.description: Government-led programme is providing an early warning of coronavirus outbreaks by monitoring sewage and sharing data with NHS Test & Trace

tweets.text:
The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

tweets.text: Yes good to see some analysis to explain the capacity gap that exists between rising environmental ambitions & the ability to deliver on that. @NaturalEngland & @EnvAgency ready to do the job, but we need the means https://t.co/bEZkSXnDPm

a city without reeds is a city without nature's hush-awhile whispers, here by @CodyDock Bromley-by-Bow #LondonRiversWeek2020 @WildLondon @Thames21 @LeeValleyPark @EnvAgencySE @ThamesEstPart @SE_Rivers_Trust @CVP_CraneValley @ColneCAN @LDN_environment @CanalRiverTrust https://t.co/35x3NFA780

Happy #WorldFishMigrationDay🐟
Last year @GroundworkGM along with the @EnvAgency and other @natural_course key partners, led the removal of a weir on Eagley Brook in Bolton, opening up 2 kilometres of the brook to fish, including Brown Trout.
